posts.post_content:
[IMG]https://photos.imageevent.com/bicem/forsale/websize/1910%20Chillicothe.jpg[/IMG]

1910 Chillicothe Babes
MLBer’s: Ed Irwin (middle row, far left)
*Irwin played one game as replacement player in 1912 protest game for Ty Cobb’s suspension for beating up a fan
*Irwin later killed by being thrown out a saloon window during a bar fight, still holds record (tied) for most career triples w/o any other hits with two)
clean, unused back
$125

[IMG]https://photos.imageevent.com/bicem/forsale/websize/Oneonta.jpg[/IMG]

1911 Oneonta
MLBer’s: Heinie Stafford (also played just one game) plus Joe Conzulman, Ken Nash, Wally Snell
*Postcard was mailed by Carl Loud (front row, second from right) to his wife with a cool note about life playing games on the road
(scanner light shows much more silvering than actually seen in person)
$125

[IMG]https://photos.imageevent.com/bicem/forsale/websize/Hastings.jpg[/IMG]

1910’s Unknown Michigan team
Player must be an Old Hoss fan!  First time I’ve seen this on a baseball postcard.
(mailed in Hastings, Michigan)
$125

[IMG]https://photos.imageevent.com/bicem/forsale/websize/Dallas%20Steers.jpg[/IMG]

1927 Dallas Steers
MLBer’s: Many, see all players [URL="https://www.baseball-reference.com/bullpen/File:Dallas-Steers-baseball-team.jpg"]here[/URL].
clean, unused back
$175

[IMG]https://photos.imageevent.com/bicem/forsale/websize/store%20front.jpg[/IMG]

[IMG]https://photos.imageevent.com/bicem/forsale/websize/store%20close.jpg[/IMG]

1910’s Tobacco & Candy Store RPPC
Mecca and Fatima advertising in the windows, can only imagine the treasure trove inside!
clean, unused back
$125
bump to remove sold and price reductions
